Description: Fragment of lower body of East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed with added red bands lined in white; exterior: yellowish slip; band with added colour lines above stopt maeander frieze; two bands below and rays at base with rosettes between.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
242 2 on label (= reference (erroneous) to Kardara, Rodiaki Angeiographia); burnt both sides. Compare BM 1888,0601.535 for the general syntax.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1112)
